content.en: A young girl's love of books is changing lives! She loves to read. She wants to help kids everywhere to read, learn, and grow.
content.tw: 有個女孩，她對書本的熱愛正在改變生命! 她要幫助世界各地的兒童閱讀和學習。

content.en: The girl found a group online. It helps kids to study. She volunteered. She read books online with students in India. She had a great time!
content.tw: 這個女孩志願參加幫助兒童學習的線上團體，她很喜歡在網路上，和印度的學生一起唸故事!

content.en: Next, she started her own group. She worked with more than 70 schools in Taiwan. She helped many students!
content.tw: 接著，她成立自己的團隊，跟超過 70 個台灣的學校合作，幫助很多學生!

content.en: Then she started another group! It runs online reading clubs. It's for girls all over the world!
content.tw: 然後，她又成立了第二個團隊! 這是給世界各地女孩參加的線上讀書會。

content.en: Last year, this girl won a Taishin Youth Volunteer Award. It's for junior high and high school students who help others.
content.tw: 去年，這個女孩贏得了台新青少年志工菁英獎，這個獎項鼓勵那些幫助其他人的國高中生。

content.en: She got a medal. Her favorite charity got money. She went on study trips abroad!
content.tw: 她得到了獎盃、為喜歡的公益團體募款，還出國遊學!

content.en: This year's awards are soon. Do you know junior high or high school students in Taiwan who love to volunteer? They can sign up! Maybe they'll win! Sign up ends on October 31st! Are you too young for the award this year? Well, you're not too young to volunteer. It will make you feel good!
content.tw: 今年的獎項即將到來。你認識台灣有喜歡當志工的國高中生嗎？他們可以報名！也許他們會獲獎！報名截止日期是10月31日！你今年是否太年輕無法參與這個獎項？嗯，你還沒年輕到不能當志工。當志工會讓你感覺很好！

vocabulary.preface: 當志工可以服務人群，增廣見聞。

content.text:
1. volunteer 當志工.
Oh my God! I want to volunteer for this! 天哪，我要去當這個志工!
For… eating at Michelin restaurants? 吃米其林餐廳的志工?
No! For the World Masters Games! 不是! 壯年運動會的志工!

2. work 工作.
Masters in playing video games? 玩電腦遊戲的大師?
No, masters in sports! 不，運動大師.
Oh, I get it. 我懂了.
You like working with handsome athletes. 你喜歡跟帥帥運動員一起做事.
Who wouldn't? 誰會不喜歡?

3. all over the world 世界各地.
Plus I'll get to meet people from all over the world!

4. start 開始.
So what do volunteers do? 所以志工做些什麼?
I don't know. Starting a race with a gunshot? 我也不知道。鳴槍讓賽跑開始?

vocabulary.postscript:
今天學到那些字?
volunteer當志工 work工作 all over the world世界各地 start開始

quiz.question: 1. What does last year's award winner love?
2. What do award winners get?
3. When does sign up end for this award this year?

content.en: Many people in Taiwan have dogs. And many people have cats.
content.tw: 許多台灣人養狗。也有許多人養貓。

content.en: Do you think there are more pet dogs in Taiwan? Or are there more pet cats?
content.tw: 很多台灣人都有養寵物，你覺得養小狗的人比較多，還是養貓咪的人?

content.en: Think about that for a few seconds. Time's up!
content.tw: 想幾秒鐘。時間到！

content.en: Did you say dogs? You are right! There are more than one million pet dogs in Taiwan.
content.tw: 給你幾秒猜猜看，你的答案是小狗嗎 ? 那你猜對了 ! 台灣有超過百萬隻寵物狗。

content.en: But there are also more than a million pet cats, too. Are you surprised there are so many cats here?
content.tw: 但台灣也有超過百萬隻寵物貓。你驚訝這裡有這麼多貓嗎？

content.en: There were less than a million cats in Taiwan three years ago.
content.tw: 但也有超過百萬隻寵物貓咪，你很驚訝嗎？ 三年前，貓咪還不到100萬隻。

content.en: There were almost 900,000 pet cats then.
content.tw: 那時有將近90萬隻寵物貓。

content.en: Last year, there were more than 1,300,000! Wow! That's a LOT more cats in a short time!
content.tw: 那時候，台灣有差不多90萬隻貓咪，但去年，增加到130萬隻。短短時間多了這麼多貓咪!

content.en: Now there is a new rule about pet cats in Taiwan.
content.tw: 現在台灣對於寵物貓有了新規定。

content.en: People who have cats must register them. To register, cats must get a microchip.
content.tw: 養貓的人必須為牠們登記。要登記，貓咪必須植入晶片。

content.en: People who don't register their cats might have to pay from three thousand to fifteen thousand Taiwan dollars!
content.tw: 台灣有一個新規定，養貓咪需要先植入一個小小的晶片，然後去登記，沒有登記的人可能會被罰3千到1萬5千台幣!

content.en: Does your family have a cat? Make sure it is registered and has a microchip! Tell your family!
content.tw: 你的家人有養貓嗎？請確保牠已登記並植入晶片！告訴你的家人！

vocabulary.preface: 養寵物貓狗很流行，但是要遵守規定。

content.text: 1. there are 有。 One, two, three… five cats on this street. 一,二,三...五隻貓在這條街上。There are five cats on just one short street!一條短短的街就有五隻貓!
2. surprised 驚訝的。 Why are you so surprised? 你為什麼這麼驚訝? Cats love this street. 貓咪就喜歡這條街。 No, someone must be feeding them. 不，一定有人在餵牠們。 Some people don't like cats around their house.有的人不喜歡屋子附近有貓。
3. have to 必須。 But we have to help the kittens. 但是我們得幫忙小貓。 We need to help find homes for them.我們需要替他們找個家。
4. microchip 晶片。 When they have homes, they can get microchips. 牠們有了自己家就可以植入晶片。 And they'll have a safe place to live.也有安全的地方住。

vocabulary.postscript: 我們今天學到哪些用法? there are有 surprised驚訝的 have to必須 microchip晶片

quiz.question: 1. How many pet dogs are there in Taiwan?
2. Which pets have to be registered now?
3. How do people register their pet?
options: a. Get a microchip for it.
b. Give it a nice name.

content.en: Eight, nine, ten… phew! Exercise is hard work! But kids in Taiwan need more exercise. It's very important for good health.
content.tw: 呼! 運動很辛苦，但台灣的小孩需要做更多運動，這對健康非常重要。

content.en: Do you know two important things to do when you exercise? They are warming up and stretching!
content.tw: 當你做運動時有兩件很重要的事: 就是暖身和拉筋!

content.en: A researcher says to warm up first. You can walk, jog, or ride a bike. Warm up for five to ten minutes. Then you are ready to move more!
content.tw: 專家說可以先走路、慢跑或騎腳踏車暖身，大概五到十分鐘，這樣你就準備好做更多運動。

content.en: Stretching helps your body move more easily. Some people say to stretch before exercising. Others say to do it after.
content.tw: 拉筋會讓你身體更靈活，有人說應該在運動前做，有人在運動後。

content.en: The researcher says both can be good! But you need to know how to stretch. And don't stretch until you hurt! If you hurt, stop!
content.tw: 專家說兩種都很好! 但是你要知道怎麼拉筋，不要拉到受傷，如果拉傷了就要停下來!

content.en: Here's one way to stretch. You stand up. Keep your legs straight. Then reach for your toes. Don't move... for one minute!
content.tw: 這裡有個拉筋的好方法: 你站起來，保持你的腿是直的，然後手往腳趾頭延伸，保持一分鐘不動!

content.en: The researcher says to stretch one minute for each group of muscles. That's not too long. You won't get tired. And your body gets a good stretch! You'll feel good!
content.tw: 專家說每個肌肉群只要拉筋一分鐘，身體就能好好地得到延伸!

content.en: Warming up, stretching, and exercising can help you be healthy! Try a good stretch now!
content.tw: 暖身、拉筋和運動能幫助你保持健康！現在就來好好地拉筋吧！

vocabulary.preface: 拉筋是暖身的一部份，可以預防運動傷害。

content.text: 1. first 首先。 Alright, Jane, before we start, we need to stretch first.我們開始之前先得來伸展。 Ugh, do we have to? 一定要嗎? Yes, we do. You'll see. 一定要，你之後會了解。
2. toe 腳趾。 Stand up straight, and then try touching your toes. 站直，然後試著碰你的腳趾。 My toes? I can hardly touch my knees! 腳趾? 我連膝蓋都幾乎碰不到!
3. muscle 肌肉。 You can do it, Jane. 你做得到。 Good job! Let's do it again. 做得很好，再來一次。 Stretch your muscles and touch your toes! 伸展肌肉，手碰腳趾。
4. body 身體。 My body will thank me later, right? 我的身體以後會感謝我，對吧? Exactly! 正是!

vocabulary.postscript: 來讀今天的單字。 first首先 toe腳趾 muscle肌肉 body身體

quiz.question: 1. What do some people say about stretching?
2. What does stretching do?
3. How long does the researcher say to stretch one group of muscles?

content.en: A U.S. magazine chose a Kid of the Year! This 15-year-old boy plays music and reads a lot. He plays basketball and chess. And he makes soap. It can help people with skin cancer!
content.tw: 美國一份雜誌選出年度最有影響力的小孩，這個十五歲的男孩會彈奏音樂、讀很多書，他會打籃球跟下棋，他還會做特別的肥皂，幫助皮膚癌病人。

content.en: The boy started mixing soaps and other things when he was four. He wanted to see what happened. When he was seven, he got a kids' science set. Then he had an idea for something to help the world.
content.tw: 他四歲時，就開始把肥皂跟其他東西混在一起，看看會做出什麼。七歲那年他得到一組兒童科學套組，讓他想到了幫助世界的點子。

content.en: Millions of people get skin cancer. It costs about one million Taiwan dollars to get better… But lots of people can't pay. The boy wants to make soap for them. It has skin cancer medicine in it!
content.tw: 好幾百萬人有皮膚癌，但是治療費用需要上百萬台幣，很多人付不起。所以這個男孩把皮膚癌的藥混在肥皂裡，來幫助病人。

content.en: The boy worked on his soap at home. It was hard! He asked a company for help. Now an engineer there helps him think about his soap. He asked university scientists for help. Now this high school student works on his soap at a university!
content.tw: 他曾經在家製作肥皂，但很困難，他向一間公司求助，現在有一位工程師在幫他，他向大學裡的科學家求助，現在這個高中生在一間大學裡面做肥皂。

content.en: The Kid of the Year is making his great idea real. He wants everyone to think of ideas to make the world better!
content.tw: 年度少年正在將他的偉大想法付諸實現。他希望每個人都能想出讓世界變得更好的點子！

vocabulary.preface: 這個少年的聰明主意，可以幫助數百萬癌症病人。

content.text: 1. medicine 藥品. I wish I could invent medicine that cures cancer. 我希望發明治療癌症的藥. Yeah, if you were a scientist. 對，假如你是科學家的話.
2. hard 困難的. It shouldn't be too hard, right? 那應該不難吧? Being a scientist? 當科學家嗎? No, as long as you're good at math.不難，只要你數學好.
3. help 幫助. I was never good at math.我的數學從來就不好. Well, we have AI now. 我們現在有人工智慧了. It can help you learn. 它可以幫你學.
4. ask for 請求. You can ask for help anytime, anywhere you want. 你可以隨時隨地請它幫你. Really? I need it now. 真的嗎? 那我現在就需要. I want to ask how to make more money. 我要問怎麼樣多賺點錢.

vocabulary.postscript: 你今天學到哪些單字? medicine藥品 hard困難的 help幫助 ask for請求

quiz.question: 1. How old was the Kid of the Year when he started mixing things?
2. What does the Kid of the Year's soap have?
3. Who did the Kid of the Year ask for help?

title: Teens' Machine Takes Microplastics from Water

content.en: Plastic is everywhere. We drink from plastic bottles. We carry the items we buy in plastic bags. Even parts of our homes are made of plastic!
content.tw: 塑膠到處都有，我們用塑膠瓶喝水。我們買的東西裝在塑膠袋裡面，甚至房屋的一部份都是塑膠做的!

content.en: These big plastic items are easy to see. But there are plastics that are too small to see. The biggest are five millimeters long. They are microplastics.
content.tw: 但是除了這些，還有小到肉眼看不見的塑膠微粒，最大的也只有五毫米長。

content.en: And they are everywhere! They're on top of mountains! They're at the bottom of the ocean. They're in the water we drink. *gasp!* So they're in our bodies!
content.tw: 到處都有塑膠微粒! 山上有，海底也有，還會跟著飲用水跑進我們身體裡，天啊!

content.en: Scientists say we eat or drink two thousand pieces of microplastics every week! They say this is very bad for our health. Scientists have been trying to take microplastics out of our drinking water for a long time. But nothing has worked. And everything they've tried has been too expensive.
content.tw: 科學家說，我們每星期會吃進或者喝進肚子裡兩千個塑膠微粒，對身體很不好。科學家努力想除去飲用水裡的塑膠微粒，但方法都太貴了。

content.en: Now two seventeen-year-old kids have made a machine. Scientists say it can take most microplastics out of water! It's cheap and easy to use.
content.tw: 現在兩個十七歲的少年做出了機器，能除掉水裡大部分的塑膠微粒 ! 不只如此，它還便宜又好用。

content.en: These kids found a great way to take microplastics out of our water!
content.tw: 這些孩子們找到了一個很棒的方法來去除水中的塑膠微粒！

vocabulary.preface: 塑膠微粒是個頭痛的問題，兩個少年提出了解方。

content.text: plastic 塑膠的。 Wait, let me powder my nose. 等等，我要在鼻子上撲粉。 There, how do I look? 好了，我看起來如何?
everything 所有東西。 Of course it is. 當然啦。 Nearly everything we use on our face… 我們用在臉上的所有東西... is in plastic containers.都裝在塑膠容器裡。I know.我知道。
eat 吃。 I recycle the bottles. 我都有回收瓶子。 But the plastic may get into our bodies.但是塑膠會跑進身體裡面。 I don't eat my makeup! 我又沒有吃化妝品!
ocean 海洋。 No, the plastic will end up in the ocean, 不是，塑膠最後會進入海洋， and fish will eat it. 魚會把它吃了。 Oh, that's okay. I don't eat fish.那沒關係。我不吃魚。

vocabulary.postscript: 今天的單字很常用。 plastic塑膠的 everything所有東西 eat吃 ocean海洋

quiz.question: Which of these might be made of plastic?
options: a. A tree in a forest
b. A teacher in a class
c. A bag from a store

quiz.question: What are plastics too small to see called?
How old are the kids who made a machine?

content.en: Sea otters are cute, furry animals. They look like teddy bears. They eat a lot. They rest on their backs on the ocean. What a nice life!
content.tw: 海獺是一種毛茸茸的可愛動物，每天吃完東西就仰躺在海上休息，好休閒 !

content.en: Sea urchins are another ocean animal. They are small, round, and spiky. Ouch! They live on the ocean floor.
content.tw: 海膽是另一種海洋生物，很像一顆顆長滿了尖刺的小圓球，住在海底。

content.en: Sea urchins eat kelp. Kelp is a big, brown seaweed. Kelp grows in kelp forests. But sometimes there are too many sea urchins. And they can eat all of a kelp forest.
content.tw: 海膽喜歡吃一種大的咖啡色海藻。但有時太多的海膽會把海藻吃光 !

content.en: Fish, crabs, and other ocean animals live in kelp forests. What happens when all of a kelp forest is eaten? Many of these small ocean animals don't have a home. And big ocean animals don't have small ocean animals to eat!
content.tw: 海藻林如果被吃光，住在裡面的魚、螃蟹和小型生物無家可歸，大型海洋生物就沒有小型生物可以吃了!

content.en: But, don't worry, sea otters are saving kelp forests! They eat lots of sea urchins. They love them!
content.tw: 但別擔心! 海獺會拯救海藻林，因為牠們最愛吃海膽了。

content.en: Sea otters are the ocean's cleaners. Too many sea urchins or other animals is not good for the ocean. Sea otters come to the rescue!
content.tw: 海獺是海底的清道夫，如果出現太多海膽，牠們就會來幫忙!

content.en: Sea otters do important work. They help keep kelp forests healthy. They help ocean animals too... or eat them!
content.tw: 海獺執行重要的工作。牠們幫助維持海藻林的健康，同時也幫助海洋生物...或者把牠們吃掉！

vocabulary.preface: 太多海膽沒有關係，海獺知道該怎麼做。

content.text:
1) grow 生長。
What's a kelp forest? 海帶森林是什麼?
Haven't you seen the Harry Potter movie? 你沒看過哈利波特電影嗎?
It's long, brown strips of seaweed that grows under the sea.
它是長長的棕色海藻，長在海裡。

2) seaweed 海藻。
I remember it now. 我想起來了。
I love the seaweed that holds sushi. 我喜歡包壽司的紫菜。
That's a different kind of seaweed. 那是不同種類的海藻。
Yeah, it's delicious. 對，它很好吃。

3) crab 螃蟹。
Of all the sushi, I like crab sushi the best.
所有的壽司裡面，我最喜歡螃蟹壽司。
Gee, I don't think I've ever tried it. 我想我沒有吃過。

4) nice 很好的。
You've got to try it! 你一定要試試看!
Fresh crab is sweet and tasty. 新鮮螃蟹又甜又美味。
That sounds nice. 聽起來真不錯。

vocabulary.postscript:
今天的單字你可記得?
grow生長 seaweed海藻 crab螃蟹 nice很好的

quiz.question: 1. What happens when there are too many sea urchins?
2. What do sea otters love to eat?
3. What color is kelp?

content.en: Today is Double Ten Day! Everyone has the day off! It's a national holiday in Taiwan!
content.tw: 今天是雙十節! 全台灣的人都不用上班上課，一起慶祝國慶日 !

content.en: Double Ten Day is for all the people of Taiwan. This year's slogan is "A Beautiful Taiwan Today, A Better Taiwan Tomorrow."
content.tw: 雙十節是所有人的節慶，今年的中文標語是「中華民國生日快樂。」

content.en: The country has been getting ready for more than a month!
content.tw: 台灣為國慶日已經準備超過一個月!

content.en: There's a new logo! Taiwan's flower is between two tens. The tens are written in Chinese. The flower is a plum blossom!
content.tw: 今年也設計了全新的標誌，在兩個中文的十字中間，有一朵我們的國花梅花。

content.en: There are new souvenirs: baseball caps, towels, cups, and more! The logo and the souvenirs are red, blue, and white. These are the colors of Taiwan's flag!
content.tw: 還有全新紀念品，像是棒球帽、毛巾、杯子，都是紅、藍、白三個顏色的，跟我們的國旗一樣!

content.en: Last Saturday, a big party at Taipei Arena started the celebrations. And now... Double Ten Day is here!
content.tw: 上個星期六，台北大巨蛋辦了一場派對，開始倒數國慶日，現在終於到囉!

content.en: There's a lot to see and do. Watch the exciting parade! It's in front of the president's office! Look up at cool planes and helicopters! Wave at them! Watch 30,000 fireworks in Yunlin County!
content.tw: 國慶日可以去看總統府前的閱兵儀式，還有直升機跟飛機。雲林縣政府則會放 3 萬發煙火慶祝!

content.en: Most of all, love our beautiful country. We love Taiwan! Happy Double Ten Day!
content.tw: 最重要的是，愛我們美麗的國家。我們愛台灣！雙十節快樂！

vocabulary.preface: 雙十節是中華民國的生日，普天同慶!

content.text:
1. parade 遊行。
Hey, the big National Day parade is today! 今天就是國慶大遊行了。
I know. I can't wait for it to start.我知道，我等不及它開始了。
You're going to be there? 你要去嗎?
Certainly! 當然!

2. get ready 做準備。
Then you should get ready now.那你現在就應該做準備。
Are you kidding? It's 8 in the morning. 開玩笑，現在才早上八點。

3. all 所有的。
Do you have any idea how many people will be there? 你知道那裏會有多少人嗎?
Uh, a lot…? 很多?
Yes, all the parents will bring their children. 對，所有爸媽都會帶小孩去。

4. here 這裡。
Then I'll stay right here. 那我就待在這裡。
At home. In front of the TV.家裡，電視機前。

title: Stamps of a Taiwan Sports Star

content.en: We buy stamps at the post office. We put them on letters.
content.tw: 我們會在郵局買郵票，黏在信封上。

content.en: Stamps have pictures. Each picture shows what is important to Taiwan. There are many kinds of pictures. There are animals and trains. There are fruits and flowers. And there are people!
content.tw: 郵票上會有圖案，有時候是動物或火車，有水果跟花，有時候則是名人的照片，重點是他們對台灣很重要!

content.en: This year, a 30-year-old sports star is on Taiwan's stamps. Tai Tzu-ying is a badminton player. At 22 years old, she was the number one women's singles badminton player in the world!
content.tw: 今年，30歲的羽球明星戴資穎被印在郵票上。她在22歲那年榮獲女子單打世界冠軍!

content.en: The next year, Tai did not go to the international badminton games in the UK. Taiwan was hosting a big international sports event at the same time. Tai wanted to welcome everyone to Taiwan!
content.tw: 之後一年，小戴沒有去英國的比賽，因為台灣當時正要舉辦世大運，她希望吸引更多人來台灣!

content.en: Tai was the number one player for more than four years.
content.tw: 超過四年的時間裡，小戴一直維持世界冠軍。

content.en: Tai was busy. She got her Ph.D. She became a doctor! Dr. Tai said when you have a hard time, "you can cry, you can be sad, but you must never give up."
content.tw: 她還是很忙碌，她拿到了博士學位! 戴博士說:遇到困難時可以難過，但絕對不能放棄!

content.en: Tai is important to Taiwan. Taiwan is important to Tai! What a great person to put on Taiwan's stamps!
content.tw: 戴資穎對台灣很重要，台灣對她也很重要！真是個很適合登上台灣郵票的偉人！

vocabulary.preface: 戴資穎是羽球女王，連郵票上也看得到她。

content.text:
1. great 很棒的。
I watched a great movie last night.我昨晚看了很棒的電影。
It's about the first woman to swim across the English Channel.
講第一個泳渡英吉利海峽的女子。
That's really something! 真了不起!

2. sports star 體育明星。
Yeah, and she became a big sports star. 她成了體育大明星。
When did it happen? 什麼時候的事?

3. give up 放棄。
About 100 years ago, when most women didn't swim at all.
大約一百年前，當時絕大部分女性根本不游泳。
But she did.但是她游。
She did. 她游。
She never gave up.她從來沒有放棄。

4. have a hard time 遭遇困難。
I'm sure she had a hard time telling people she could do it.
她一定很難說服別人她做得到。
True. 沒錯。
